data.description: Investigates discourses of social responsibility in the French-speaking professional world and across sectors, in the fields of international development, marketing, management, and administration. By studying how concepts of socially responsible practice are represented in business and professional writing in France, Quebec and Francophone Africa, consider how trends in one's own concentration areas relate to those of classmates and future colleagues. Taught in French.
data.title: SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY IN CONTEMPORARY FRENCH-LANGUAGE PROFESSIONAL WRITING

data.description: Professional internship abroad, in a French-speaking business or organization, in the student's professional field.
data.title: PROFESSIONAL FRENCH MASTERS PROGRAM INTERNSHIP

data.description: Study and analysis of the culture and sociology of professional environments in the French and Francophone worlds, including government, international organizations, NGO's and business. Students develop communication skills through interactive teaching methods in multimedia labs.
data.title: PROFESSIONAL COMMUNICATION AND CULTURE IN THE FRANCOPHONE WORLD
INTERDISCIPLINARY WESTERN EUROPEAN AREA STUDIES SEMINAR

data.description: A study of how culture has evolved over the course of French history, in relation to a chosen topic. Taught in French.
data.title: FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE CULTURAL STUDIES ACROSS THE CENTURIES

data.description: A study of how literature has evolved over the course of French history, in relation to a chosen topic. Taught in French.
data.title: FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE LITERARY STUDIES ACROSS THE CENTURIES

data.description: A study of the latest developments in contemporary French Literature. Taught in French.
data.title: ASPECTS OF CONTEMPORARY FRENCH LITERATURE

data.description: Accelerated development of Italian oral, reading and writing skills, equivalent to the completion of bothITALIAN 203andITALIAN 204.
data.title: ACCELERATED INTERMEDIATE ITALIAN

data.description: Accelerated development of communicative literacy skills in French and exploration of the contemporary French-speaking world, equivalent to the completion of bothFRENCH 101andFRENCH 102.
data.title: ACCELERATED INTRODUCTORY FRENCH

data.description: Advanced independent study as arranged with a faculty member.
data.title: DIRECTED STUDY

data.description: Advanced independent study as arranged with a faculty member.
data.title: DIRECTED STUDY

data.description: Advanced oral practice and conversation, grammar review, reading, vocabulary expansion, creative writing and study of French and Francophone cultures.
data.title: FOURTH SEMESTER FRENCH

data.description: Advanced study of 18th-century French literature and culture, in relation to a chosen topic. Taught in French.
data.title: THE AGE OF REASON

data.description: Advanced study of important literary works of the 17th century. Taught in French.
data.title: 17TH-CENTURY LITERATURE

data.description: Advanced study of important literary works of the 20th century. Taught in French.
data.title: THE 20TH-CENTURY FRENCH NOVEL

data.description: An introduction to French colonialism in the New World and its effects on African-American, Afro-Creole, Native American, Franco-American, Cajun, and Caribbean diasporan communities in the U.S. through literature, history, and culture.
data.title: ETHNIC STUDIES IN THE FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE WORLD(S)

data.description: An introduction to graduate studies in French that provides the necessary skills for success. Includes exploration of structure and expectations of graduate programs, the basics of scholarly research, reflection upon research interests and possible individual scholarly identities, and academic conferences. Taught in French.
data.title: RESEARCH LABORATORY I: INTRODUCTION TO GRADUATE RESEARCH

data.description: An introduction to political, social, intellectual, artistic and literary developments in French and Francophone culture, within the time period from the French Revolution to the current era. Taught in French.
data.title: MODERNITY STUDIES

data.description: An introduction to reading and analyzing literary works, comics, and film, with special emphasis on the development of writing skills in French.
data.title: LITERATURE, COMICS, AND FILM IN FRENCH

data.description: An introduction to the political, social, intellectual, artistic and literary development of French culture, from its origins to the French Revolution (1789). Taught in French.
data.title: MEDIEVAL AND EARLY MODERN CULTURE

data.description: An introduction to theoretical and critical thinking about literary and visual texts, meant to accompany and supplement interpretative skills. Fundamental notions of rhetoric (principles of versification) and principles of narratology designed to improve the practice of close reading in poetry, drama, prose, and cinema across time periods. Taught in French.
data.title: CRITICAL APPROACHES TO LITERATURE AND CULTURE: FRENCH AND FRANCOPHONE PERSPECTIVES

data.description: An introductory, interdisciplinary area of French studies with a focus on French literary texts in English translation.
data.title: FRENCH LITERARY AND INTERDISCIPLINARY STUDIES

data.description: An overview of the global humanitarian NGO, Doctors without Borders (or Médecins sans Frontières MSF) including its history, mission, organization, and the cultural, political, and ethical challenges it faces. Explores issues of global health, social justice, and humanitarian action. Features distinguished global practitioners with first-hand experience in health crisis situations.
data.title: DOCTORS WITHOUT BORDERS (MÉDECINS SANS FRONTIÈRES)

data.description: Aspects of French culture as manifested in painting, photography, film or other visual media in relation to literature. Taught in French.
data.title: VISUAL CULTURE IN FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE STUDIES

data.description: Choice of themes and periods studied will vary, and may range from historical surveys of the meanings of health and illness across the spectrum of French and Francophone cultures, to a close examination of texts or literary genres from a particular time that incorporate or respond to biomedical knowledge. Genre studied could include prose fiction, theater, creative non-fiction, film, comics, and works of medical popularization. Taught in French.
data.title: LITERATURE AND MEDICINE IN FRENCH-SPEAKING CULTURES

data.description: Cultural study of contemporary Francophone Africa, focusing on issues in government, organizations and enterprise. Exploration of cultural and professional relations between Francophone Africa and France, the European Union, and the United States.
data.title: CONTEMPORARY ISSUES IN BUSINESS, GOVERNMENT AND NGOS

data.description: Develop writing and oral expression at an advanced level through writing and discussion of internet journalism, translation, or creative genres. Taught in French.
data.title: ADVANCED WRITING WORKSHOP

data.description: Development of accurate and nuanced capacity for expression in Italian and for understanding the spoken and written language. Also addresses Italian phonetics and phonology to develop accurate pronunciation.
data.title: ADVANCED ITALIAN LANGUAGE

data.description: Dissertation writing practicum.
data.title: SEMINAR-MATERIALS AND METHODS OF RESEARCH

data.description: Enhance writing and speaking proficiency through cultural readings on France and  the francophone world. Review of grammar and focus on more complex grammatical structures.
data.title: INTERMEDIATE LANGUAGE AND CULTURE

data.description: Enhances speaking in an informal, conversational atmosphere at the French House. Taught in French.
data.title: PRACTICAL FRENCH CONVERSATION

data.description: Examines how contemporary business and professional writing in French portrays professional skill sets for readers in Francophone Europe and North America, and to a lesser extent in Francophone Africa, particularly in the fields of international education, international development, marketing, management, and administration. Taught in French.
data.title: CONTEMPORARY SKILL SET LITERATURE IN FRENCH

data.description: Exploration of a thematic selection of texts from the Early Modern period. Taught in French.
data.title: READINGS IN EARLY MODERN LITERATURE

data.description: Exploration of a thematic selection of texts from the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. Taught in French.
data.title: READINGS IN MEDIEVAL AND RENAISSANCE LITERATURE

data.description: Explores a specific topic in the history of French and/or Francophone literature and culture; includes analysis and interpretation of texts and/or film in their historical contexts. May be focused on one, or cut across different literary periods. Applies diverse interpretative methodologies to a coherent body of material. Taught in French.
data.title: TOPICS IN LITERATURE AND CULTURE

data.description: Explores how women from different francophone regions (North and Sub-Saharan Africa and the Middle East) gain agency through literature, movies, comics, and songs, contesting different forms of domination, exclusion, and injustice, based on gender, race, class, and religion.
data.title: REBELLIOUS WOMEN

data.description: French grammar and style, with a special focus on various critical and professional applications. Taught in French.
data.title: ADVANCED GRAMMAR

data.description: Further enhances speaking in an informal, conversational atmosphere at the French House. Taught in French.
data.title: PRACTICAL FRENCH CONVERSATION

data.description: Grammatical review and stylistic practice. Taught in French.
data.title: GRAMMAR AND STYLE

data.description: Intended for instructors of elementary- and intermediate-level collegiate instructors of Italian; key concepts of communicative, literacy-oriented language teaching and related techniques for classroom instruction of Italian.
data.title: ISSUES IN METHODS OF TEACHING FRENCH AND ITALIAN

data.description: Intensive grammar and reading for those with little or no experience in French. Readings from appropriate texts in the humanities, sciences, social sciences.
data.title: FRENCH FOR READING KNOWLEDGE

data.description: Introduction to important literary works from the medieval era to the French Revolution. Taught in French.
data.title: MEDIEVAL AND EARLY MODERN FRENCH LITERATURE

data.description: Introduction to important literary works of modernity (from the French Revolution to the twenty-first century). Taught in French.
data.title: MODERN FRENCH AND FRANCOPHONE LITERATURE

data.description: Introduction to structural similarities and differences apparent in major Romance languages (French, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish) and to their historical developments, with reference to basic linguistic features of each language: phonology, morphology, syntax, and lexicon.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO THE ROMANCE LANGUAGES

data.description: Introduction to teaching collegiate world languages with an emphasis on communicative and literacy-based pedagogical strategies.
data.title: COLLEGE TEACHING OF FRENCH

data.description: Learn to write essays on a variety of topics, using different registers of French, and work to correct pronunciation and improve conversation skills. Taught in French.
data.title: ADVANCED COMPOSITION AND SPEAKING

data.description: Literary and philosophical trends of the Age of Enlightenment with special emphasis on Montesquieu, Voltaire, Diderot, and Rousseau. Taught in French.
data.title: 17TH-CENTURY FRENCH LITERATURE

data.description: Mentored reading and research for students with dissertator status.
data.title: INDIVIDUAL RESEARCH

data.description: Modern and contemporary topics in the African francophone world, which includes both the African continent and the African diaspora. Taught in English.
data.title: MODERN AND CONTEMPORARY FRANCOPHONE TOPICS

data.description: Oral practice and conversation, grammar review, reading, vocabulary expansion, creative writing and study of French and Francophone cultures.

data.description: Oral practice and conversation, grammar, reading, vocabulary building, and study of Italian cultures.
data.title: SECOND SEMESTER ITALIAN

data.description: Overview of cinematic works from francophone Africa and/or other areas of Africa. Teaches analysis and writing about cinema. Explores links between cinema and national or regional politics and ideology. Examines spectatorship in relation to questions of identity formation.
data.title: AFRICAN/FRANCOPHONE FILM

data.description: Particular emphasis on discussion, research, and collective preparation of readings, on a topic within French and/or Francophone cultural studies. Taught in French.
data.title: UNDERGRADUATE SEMINAR IN FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE CULTURAL STUDIES

data.description: Particular emphasis on discussion, research, and collective preparation of readings, on a topic within French and/or Francophone literary studies. Taught in French.
data.title: UNDERGRADUATE SEMINAR IN FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE LITERARY STUDIES

data.description: Professional communication for advanced speakers of French, with a particular focus on intercultural analysis, nonverbal communication, and public speaking. Taught in French.
data.title: ORAL COMMUNICATION

data.description: Provides the necessary skills for success in the PhD program. Includes exploration of structure and expectations, as well as of the professional skills needed to succeed in the profession after graduation. Taught in French.
data.title: RESEARCH LABORATORY II: PRODUCING PROFESSIONAL RESEARCH

data.description: Representative French-language films will be studied from an esthetic and a cultural perspective. Choice of themes and periods studied will vary, and may range from historical surveys to a close examination of films from a particular time or place. Taught in French.
data.title: FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE FILM

data.description: Selected applied language topics pertaining to teaching French as a second language. Taught in French.
data.title: APPLIED FRENCH LANGUAGE STUDIES

data.description: Study of 19th-century poetry. Taught in French.
data.title: SEMINAR ON 19TH CENTURY FRENCH POETRY

data.description: Study of French literary texts embedded in their cultural contexts, with a focus on clothing and fashion. Chart the emergence and representation of sartorial taste in France through analysis and discussion of selected texts and other media that feature clothing as a reflection of aesthetic and social values. Rather than evidence for material and economic history, literature and the visual arts will be ways to touch on issues such as the evolution of the notion of human physical beauty, of taste, of gender differences and roles, of social status and stratification in different historical contexts.
data.title: FRENCH FASHION AND LITERATURE FROM THE MIDDLE AGES TO TODAY

data.description: Study of French sounds, phonetic transcription, practice in pronunciation. Taught in French.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO PHONETICS

data.description: Study of important literary works of the 14th and 15th centuries. Taught in French.
data.title: LA LITTERATURE FRANCAISE DU XIV ET DU XV SIECLE

data.description: Study of literary texts from diverse Francophone cultures (Africa, the Caribbean, Quebec) and the cultural and political dynamics between these texts and these cultures. Taught in French.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO FRANCOPHONE STUDIES

data.description: Study of literature and culture organized thematically or by time period. Taught in French.
data.title: SEMINAR: LITERATURE QUESTIONS

data.description: Study of literature and culture organized thematically or by time period. Taught in French.
data.title: SEMINAR: LITERATURE QUESTIONS

data.description: Study published contemporary French-language writing on career strategies for emerging professionals and professionals in transition in Europe, Africa and North America. Taught in French.
data.title: CAREER STRATEGIES FOR THE FRENCH-SPEAKING WORLD

data.description: Survey of major socio-political, cultural, and economic developments in the major French-speaking regions of the world, with a focus on Europe, Africa and Canada. Taught in French.
data.title: CULTURE AND SOCIETIES

data.title: STUDY ABROAD: FRENCH/FRANCOPHONE CIVILIZATION
